def_en: If you crunch something hard, such as a sweet, you crush it noisily between your teeth.

def_cn: (使)发出碎裂声;(使)嘎吱作响
def_en: If something crunches or if you crunch it, it makes a breaking or crushing noise, for example when you step on it.

def_cn: (在小石子铺成的路上)嘎吱嘎吱地行进
def_en: If you crunch across a surface made of very small stones, you move across it causing it to make a crunching noise.
You can refer to an important time or event, for example when an important decision has to be made, as the crunch .

def_cn: (用计算器或计算机大量地)处理(数字)
def_en: To crunch numbers means to do a lot of calculations using a calculator or computer.

def_cn: 缺少资金;经济收缩;财政困难
def_en: A situation in which a business or economy has very little money can be referred to as a crunch .
